intro: Tripleurospermum decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive ray floret, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets that resemble those of other similar species, a feature that may aid in its pollination strategy. It typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
